Name: Bolle Jan
Review Text: Traditional, super dutch!

Name: Bolle Jan
Review Text:
A tiny little bar which could fit 50 in at a push. I went on a Monday night and there was singing and dancing as if it we the weekend.
The singer sung a mix of Dutch and English songs and the vibe was welcoming of tourists but not made for tourists - well worth a visit.

Name: Bolle Jan
Review Text: I have been here several times in the past and I always enjoyed it. Today I brought two Asian friends of mine here, and we were stopped by the door man, who told us it's full (but it's not) and there is no point waiting. I can't find a word ‚Ä¶

Name: Bolle Jan
Review Text: One of the oddest places I ever visited in my life. Great if you like a traditional Amsterdam setup, but it was ever so surreal. The music was dreadful and it was odd to have to tip the toilet lady - after a lot of beers you see her a lot. ‚Ä¶

Name: Bolle Jan
Review Text: This place is incredible. We came from Chicago and stumbled upon this place, and it was the best find of the trip. 95% locals (we're still not sure if we were even supposed to be there!), and a Dutch singer singing Dutch singalong songs ‚Ä¶

Name: Bolle Jan
Review Text: I tried to enter this bar on Saturday night and the entrance was blocked. The argument is that this bar is only for locals (the security guy was a typical Dutch guy from Suriname or some orther place). I didnt try to change is mind but I'm as local as he is... this is racism and is not acceptable for a city as Amsterdam.

Name: Bolle Jan
Review Text: Music was loud, crowd was dancing and the guy singing was great. I didn't know hardly any songs but the vibe was infectious. Bartenders were smiling and singing, music created 100db, and I learned who Rene Froger is.

Name: Bolle Jan
Review Text: Good. Live singer, full bar. Famous and a little corny. Wonderful!

Review Text: Great memories of fantastic night here in 1998. Great Bar, Great atmosphere, great staff
